sys_ui_page.html:
Delhi Public School Information

Delhi Public School

Established: 1995

Principal: Madhan Reddy

School Timings: 9 am to 4 pm

School Address

Delhi Public School, Nacharam, Hyderabad, 500076.

Landmark: Opposite Prasad Hospital.

Fee Structure
Category Admission Fee (One-time) Books Fee (per year) Bus Fee (per year) Student Fee (per year) Total Annual Fee (excluding optional services)
Pre-Primary (Nursery, LKG, UKG) $300 $100 Within 5 km: $500

5 - 10 km: $750

Above 10 km: $1,000		 $300 $400 - $400
Primary School (Class 1 - 5) $400 $150 Within 5 km: $500

5 - 10 km: $750

Above 10 km: $1,000		 $400 $1,000 - $1,550
Middle School (Class 6 - 8) $500 $175 Within 5 km: $500

5 - 10 km: $750

Above 10 km: $1,000		 $450 $1,100 - $1,625
High School (Class 9 - 10) $600 $200 Within 5 km: $500

5 - 10 km: $750

Above 10 km: $1,000		 $500 $1,300 - $1,700
Total Fees
Category Total Annual Fee (excluding optional services)
Pre-Primary $400 - $400
Primary School $1,000 - $1,550
Middle School $1,100 - $1,625
High School $1,300 - $1,700
Facilities

Labs: Fully equipped Science, Computer, and Language labs.

Library: Extensive collection of academic and reference materials.

Sports and Extracurricular Activities
Category Activities
Sports Volleyball, Kho-Kho, Kabaddi, Yoga, Basketball, Football, Badminton, Table Tennis, Athletics
Extracurricular Activities Music, Dance, Art, Drama
Scholarship Information

Merit-based Scholarships: Awarded to students based on academic excellence and achievements.

Need-based Scholarships: Provided to students based on financial need and specific eligibility criteria.

Staff
Subject Number of Teachers
English 5
Mathematics 5
Physics 5
Chemistry 5
Telugu 5
Social Studies 5
Biology 5

Support Staff: 10 staff members ensuring smooth operations.

Achievements

Academic Scholarships: Awarded to students who achieve high grades or excel in standardized tests.

Scholarships for Disabled Students: Designed to support students with disabilities in accessing education.

Scholarships for Children of Veterans: Awarded to children of military personnel or veterans.

Additional Information

School Timings:

Monday to Friday: 9 am to 4 pm

Saturday: 9 am to 2 pm

Sunday: Closed

Activities

Cultural Performances: Annual Day features a variety of cultural performances, reflecting the diversity and talents of the student body.

Theme-Based Programs: Themed events such as "Unity in Diversity" or "Environmental Awareness."

Awards and Recognition: Includes an award ceremony recognizing student achievements.

Guest Speakers: Prominent personalities or alumni are often invited as guest speakers.

Family Involvement: Parents and family members are invited to attend and celebrate with students.

Sports Day: Includes athletic competitions, team sports, and special races.

Science Fair: Showcases innovative projects, interactive exhibits, and competitions focusing on STEM education.

Contact Information

For further details, please contact the school office at 6302051396.
